alert.note: Alert for Northern Litchfield; Southern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 16 at 2:45PM EDT until May 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHWESTERN CONNECTICUT... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHWESTERN CONNECTICUT... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 001 Northern Litchfield, Fire Weather Zone 001 Northern Berkshire, Fire Weather Zone 013 Southern Litchfield and Fire Weather Zone 025 Southern Berkshire. * Timing...For the Red Flag Warning, this afternoon through sunset. For the Fire Weather Watch, on Wednesday with the most critical conditions between late morning and sunset. * Winds...Southwest at 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 25 mph late this afternoon into this evening. Northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 20 percent. * Temperatures...In the mid 60s to mid 70s late today. In the 50s on Wednesday. * Lightning...None. * Impacts...Dry conditions and gusty winds may result in rapid fire spread if ignition occurs.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
